required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Single Dose Study to Assess Efficacy, Safety and Tolerability of LAS100977 in Asthmatic Patients.
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase IIa, Randomised, Single Dose, Double-blind, Double-dummy, 6 Way Complete Cross-over, Placebo Controlled Clinical Trial to Assess the Efficacy, Safety and Tolerability of 4 Doses of LAS100977 QD Compared to Placebo and an Active Comparator in Patients With Persistent Asthma.

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the pharmacodynamics of single doses of inhaled LAS100977 QD in patients with persistent asthma.

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Peak Forced Expiratory Volume in One Second (FEV1)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and +15 min, +30 min, +1 h, +2 h, +3 h, +4 h post-dose
primary_outcome.description: Baseline was the average of the two values measured just prior to the administration of the dose of investigational medicinal product at Day 1 of each visit (time points -45 min and -15 min). The peak was computed as the highest value observed for each patient during the 4-hour period immediately after the investigational medicinal product administered in the morning. At each time point, three technically adequate lung function measurements were performed by spirometry according to the acceptability and repeatability criteria of the ATS/ERS; the highest values for the FEV1 were selected.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage Change From Baseline in Peak Forced Expiratory Volume in One Second (FEV1)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and +15 min, +30 min, +1 h, +2 h, +3 h, +4 h post-dose
secondary_outcome.description: Baseline was the average of the two values measured just prior to the administration of the dose of investigational medicinal product at Day 1 of each visit (time points -45 min and -15 min). The peak was computed as the highest value observed for each patient during the 4-hour period immediately after the investigational medicinal product administered in the morning. At each time point, three technically adequate lung function measurements were performed by spirometry according to the acceptability and repeatability criteria of the ATS/ERS; the highest values for the FEV1 were selected.

secondary_outcome.measure: Peak Forced Expiratory Volume in One Second (FEV1)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: +15 min, +30 min, +1 h, +2 h, +3 h, +4 h post-dose
secondary_outcome.description: The peak was computed as the highest value observed for each patient during the 4-hour period immediately after the investigational medicinal product administered in the morning on Day 1. At each time point, three technically adequate lung function measurements were performed by spirometry according to the acceptability and repeatability criteria of the ATS/ERS; the highest values for the FEV1 were selected.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to Peak Forced Expiratory Volume in One Second (FEV1)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: +15 min, +30 min, +1 h, +2 h, +3 h, +4 h post-dose
secondary_outcome.description: The peak was computed as the highest value observed for each patient during the 4-hour period immediately after the investigational medicinal product administered in the morning. At each time point, three technically adequate lung function measurements were performed by spirometry according to the acceptability and repeatability criteria of the ATS/ERS; the highest values for the FEV1 were selected.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to Trough Forced Expiratory Volume in One Second (FEV1)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and +23 h and +24 h post-dose
secondary_outcome.description: Baseline was the average of the two values measured just prior to the administration of the dose of investigational medicinal product at Day 1 of each visit (time points -45 min and -15 min). Trough at Day 2 was computed as the average of the two values measured at 23 and 24 hours after administration of the morning dose of investigational medicinal product on Day 1. At each time point, three technically adequate lung function measurements were performed by spirometry according to the acceptability and repeatability criteria of the ATS/ERS; the highest values for the FEV1 and FVC were selected.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Normalized Forced Expiratory Volume in One Second (FEV1) Area Under the Curve (AUC) 0-24h at Day 1
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and +15 min, +30 min, +1 h, +2 h, +3 h, +4 h, +6 h, +8 h, +12 h, +14 h, +23 h and +24 h
secondary_outcome.description: FEV1 was normalized to baseline. Baseline was the average of the two values measured just prior to the administration of the dose of investigational medicinal product at Day 1 of each visit (time points -45 min and -15 min). At each time point, three technically adequate lung function measurements were performed by spirometry according to the acceptability and repeatability criteria of the ATS/ERS; the highest values for the FEV1 and FVC were selected.

secondary_outcome.measure: Absolute Values of Forced Expiratory Volume (FEV1) at Each Timepoint
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and +15 min, +30 min, +1 h, +2 h, +3 h, +4 h, +6 h, +8 h, +12 h, +14 h, +23 h, +24 h, and +36 h
secondary_outcome.description: Baseline was the average of the two values measured just prior to the administration of the dose of investigational medicinal product at Day 1 of each visit (time points -45 min and -15 min). At each time point, three technically adequate lung function measurements were performed by spirometry according to the acceptability and repeatability criteria of the ATS/ERS; the highest values for the FEV1 and FVC were selected.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Forced Expiratory Volume (FEV1) at Each Timepoint
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and +15 min, +30 min, +1 h, +2 h, +3 h, +4 h, +6 h, +8 h, +12 h, +14 h, +23 h, +24 h, and +36 h
secondary_outcome.description: Baseline was the average of the two values measured just prior to the administration of the dose of investigational medicinal product at Day 1 of each visit (time points -45 min and -15 min). At each time point, three technically adequate lung function measurements were performed by spirometry according to the acceptability and repeatability criteria of the ATS/ERS; the highest values for the FEV1 and FVC were selected. The number of participants analyzed differed between timepoints - the number of participants analyzed at 0.25 h is shown.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage Change From Baseline in Forced Expiratory Volume (FEV1) at Each Timepoint
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and +15 min, +30 min, +1 h, +2 h, +3 h, +4 h, +6 h, +8 h, +12 h, +14 h, +23 h, +24 h, and +36 h

The number of participants analyzed differed between timepoints - the number of participants analyzed at 0.25 h is shown.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Peak Forced Vital Capacity (FVC)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and +15 min, +30 min, +1 h, +2 h, +3 h, +4 h post-dose
secondary_outcome.description: Baseline was the average of the two values measured just prior to the administration of the dose of investigational medicinal product at Day 1 of each visit (time points -45 min and -15 min). The peak was computed as the highest value observed for each patient during the 4-hour period immediately after the investigational medicinal product administered in the morning. At each time point, three technically adequate lung function measurements were performed by spirometry according to the acceptability and repeatability criteria of the ATS/ERS; the highest values for the FEV1 and FVC were selected.

The peak was computed as the highest value observed for each patient during the 4-hour period immediately after the investigational medicinal product administered in the morning. At each time point, three technically adequate lung function measurements were performed by spirometry according to the acceptability and repeatability criteria of the ATS/ERS; the highest values for the FEV1 and FVC were selected.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to Peak Forced Vital Capacity (FVC)
secondary_outcome.description: The peak was computed as the highest value observed for each patient during the 4-hour period immediately after the investigational medicinal product administered in the morning. At each time point, three technically adequate lung function measurements were performed by spirometry according to the acceptability and repeatability criteria of the ATS/ERS; the highest values for the FEV1 and FVC were selected.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to Trough Forced Vital Capacity (FVC)
secondary_outcome.description: Baseline was the average of the two values measured just prior to the administration of the dose of investigational medicinal product at Day 1 of each visit (time points -45 min and -15 min). Trough at Day 2 was computed as the average of the two values measured at 23 and 24 hours after administration of the morning dose of investigational medicinal product on Day 1. At each time point, three technically adequate lung function measurements were performed by spirometry according to the acceptability and repeatability criteria of the ATS/ERS; the highest values for the FEV1 and FVC were selected.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Normalized Forced Vital Capacity (FVC) Area Under the Curve (AUC)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and +15 min, +30 min, +1 h, +2 h, +3 h, +4 h, +6 h, +8 h, +12 h, +14 h, +23 h and +24 h

arm_group.description: Single-dose LAS100977 0.625 μg, during double-blind treatment period
Single-dose LAS100977 1.25 μg, during double-blind treatment period
Single-dose LAS100977 2.5 μg, during double-blind treatment period
Single-dose salbutamol 400 μg, during double-blind treatment period
Placebo to LAS100977, and placebo to salbutamol
Single-dose LAS100977 0.313 μg, during double-blind treatment period

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Adult male and female patients aged 18-70 years (both included).
2. Clinical diagnosis of persistent asthma (according to GINA guidelines 2009 update) for at least 6 months prior to screening.
3. Screening FEV1 value of 60% < FEV1 ≤ 85% of the predicted normal value.
4. FEV1 reversibility ≥ 12% and an absolute increase of at least 200 ml over baseline value after inhalation of 400µg (four inhalations) of salbutamol.
5. Pre-dose FEV1 value of first treatment period within the range of ± 20% of the FEV1 measured at screening prior to salbutamol inhalation.
6. Patients on a stable dose and regimen
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Current smokers, former smokers within the last 6 months, or ex-smokers with a history of more than 10 pack-years.
2. Patients diagnosed with COPD.
3. Recent Respiratory tract infections within 6 weeks before Screening Visit.
4. Intubation (ever) or hospitalization for longer than 24 hours for the management of an asthma exacerbation within the preceding 6 weeks of the screening visit.
5. Clinically significant respiratory conditions.
6. Clinically significant cardiovascular conditions.
7. Patients unable to properly use a dry powder or pMDI inhaler device or unable to perform acceptable spirometry.
8. Clinically relevant abnormalities laboratory, ECG parameters or physical examination results at the screening evaluation that in the investigator's opinion, preclude study participation.
9. Patients who intend to use any concomitant medication not permitted by this protocol or who have not undergone the required washout period for a particular prohibited medication.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: The study was conducted in 10 sites in Germany and United Kingdom, 9 of which randomized patients
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Screening took place 12-16 days before randomization. After screening, eligible patients entered a run-in period to assess clinical stability. A total of 115 patients were screened; 62 patients were assessed as eligible and randomized; 53 were not randomized due to screening failure (primarily non-fulfillment of inclusion/exclusion criteria)

group.title: Sequence A
group.description: Salbutamol 400 μg - LAS100977 0.313 μg - Placebo - LAS100977 0.625 μg - LAS100977 2.5 μg - LAS100977 1.25 μg

group.title: Sequence B
group.description: LAS100977 0.313 μg - LAS100977 0.625 μg - Salbutamol 400 μg - LAS100977 1.25 μg - Placebo - LAS100977 2.5 μg

group.title: Sequence C
group.description: LAS100977 0.625 μg - LAS100977 1.25 μg - LAS100977 0.313 μg - LAS100977 2.5 μg - Salbutamol 400 μg - Placebo

group.title: Sequence D
group.description: LAS100977 1.25 μg - LAS100977 2.5 μg - LAS100977 0.625 μg - Placebo - LAS100977 0.313 μg - Salbutamol 400 μg

group.title: Sequence E
group.description: LAS100977 2.5 μg - Placebo - LAS100977 1.25 μg - Salbutamol 400 μg - LAS100977 0.625 μg - LAS100977 0.313 μg

group.title: Sequence F
group.description: Placebo - Salbutamol 400 μg - LAS100977 2.5 μg - LAS100977 0.313 μg - LAS100977 1.25 μg - LAS100977 0.625 μg

drop_withdraw_reason.title: Not able to maintain visit schedule

group.title: Overall Population
group.description: Safety population defined as all patients who were randomized and received at least one dose of investigational medicinal product

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Peak Forced Expiratory Volume in One Second (FEV1)
outcome.description: Baseline was the average of the two values measured just prior to the administration of the dose of investigational medicinal product at Day 1 of each visit (time points -45 min and -15 min). The peak was computed as the highest value observed for each patient during the 4-hour period immediately after the investigational medicinal product administered in the morning. At each time point, three technically adequate lung function measurements were performed by spirometry according to the acceptability and repeatability criteria of the ATS/ERS; the highest values for the FEV1 were selected.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline and +15 min, +30 min, +1 h, +2 h, +3 h, +4 h post-dose
outcome.population: ITT population defined as patients who took at least one dose of investigational medicinal product and had at least a baseline and one post-dose value of FEV1 from at least one treatment period

group.title: LAS100977 1.25 μg
group.description: Dry powder for inhalation administered via Genuair®

group.title: LAS100977 2.5 μg
group.description: Dry powder for inhalation administered via Genuair®

group.title: Salbutamol 400 μg
group.description: Pressurised inhalation suspension administered via Ventolin Evohaler®

measure.title: Absolute Values of Forced Expiratory Volume (FEV1) at Each Timepoint
measure.description: Baseline was the average of the two values measured just prior to the administration of the dose of investigational medicinal product at Day 1 of each visit (time points -45 min and -15 min). At each time point, three technically adequate lung function measurements were performed by spirometry according to the acceptability and repeatability criteria of the ATS/ERS; the highest values for the FEV1 and FVC were selected.
measure.population: Patients in the ITT population with available data at the timepoints of interest. ITT population defined as patients who took at least one dose of investigational medicinal product and had at least a baseline and one post-dose value of FEV1 from at least one treatment period

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Forced Expiratory Volume (FEV1) at Each Timepoint
outcome.description: Baseline was the average of the two values measured just prior to the administration of the dose of investigational medicinal product at Day 1 of each visit (time points -45 min and -15 min). At each time point, three technically adequate lung function measurements were performed by spirometry according to the acceptability and repeatability criteria of the ATS/ERS; the highest values for the FEV1 and FVC were selected. The number of participants analyzed differed between timepoints - the number of participants analyzed at 0.25 h is shown.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline and +15 min, +30 min, +1 h, +2 h, +3 h, +4 h, +6 h, +8 h, +12 h, +14 h, +23 h, +24 h, and +36 h
outcome.population: Patients in the ITT population with available data at the timepoints of interest. ITT population defined as patients who took at least one dose of investigational medicinal product and had at least a baseline and one post-dose value of FEV1 from at least one treatment period

group.description: Dry powder for inhalation administered via Genuair®

group.title: LAS100977 1.25 μg
group.description: Dry powder for inhalation administered via Genuair®

group.title: LAS100977 2.5 μg
group.description: Dry powder for inhalation administered via Genuair®

group.title: Salbutamol 400 μg
group.description: Pressurised inhalation suspension administered via Ventolin Evohaler®

measure.title: Percentage Change From Baseline in Forced Expiratory Volume (FEV1) at Each Timepoint
measure.description: Baseline was the average of the two values measured just prior to the administration of the dose of investigational medicinal product at Day 1 of each visit (time points -45 min and -15 min). At each time point, three technically adequate lung function measurements were performed by spirometry according to the acceptability and repeatability criteria of the ATS/ERS; the highest values for the FEV1 and FVC were selected. The number of participants analyzed differed between timepoints - the number of participants analyzed at 0.25 h is shown.
measure.population: Patients in the ITT population with available data at the timepoints of interest. ITT population defined as patients who took at least one dose of investigational medicinal product and had at least a baseline and one post-dose value of FEV1 from at least one treatment period

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Peak Forced Vital Capacity (FVC)
outcome.description: Baseline was the average of the two values measured just prior to the administration of the dose of investigational medicinal product at Day 1 of each visit (time points -45 min and -15 min). The peak was computed as the highest value observed for each patient during the 4-hour period immediately after the investigational medicinal product administered in the morning. At each time point, three technically adequate lung function measurements were performed by spirometry according to the acceptability and repeatability criteria of the ATS/ERS; the highest values for the FEV1 and FVC were selected.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline and +15 min, +30 min, +1 h, +2 h, +3 h, +4 h post-dose
outcome.population: ITT population defined as patients who took at least one dose of investigational medicinal product and had at least a baseline and one post-dose value of FEV1 from at least one treatment period

outcome.description: The peak was computed as the highest value observed for each patient during the 4-hour period immediately after the investigational medicinal product administered in the morning. At each time point, three technically adequate lung function measurements were performed by spirometry according to the acceptability and repeatability criteria of the ATS/ERS; the highest values for the FEV1 and FVC were selected.

group.title: LAS100977 1.25 μg
group.description: Dry powder for inhalation administered via Genuair®

group.title: LAS100977 2.5 μg
group.description: Dry powder for inhalation administered via Genuair®

group.title: Salbutamol 400 μg
group.description: Pressurised inhalation suspension administered via Ventolin Evohaler®

measure.title: Time to Peak Forced Vital Capacity (FVC)
measure.description: The peak was computed as the highest value observed for each patient during the 4-hour period immediately after the investigational medicinal product administered in the morning. At each time point, three technically adequate lung function measurements were performed by spirometry according to the acceptability and repeatability criteria of the ATS/ERS; the highest values for the FEV1 and FVC were selected.
measure.population: ITT population defined as patients who took at least one dose of investigational medicinal product and had at least a baseline and one post-dose value of FEV1 from at least one treatment period

outcome.title: Change From Baseline to Trough Forced Vital Capacity (FVC)
outcome.description: Baseline was the average of the two values measured just prior to the administration of the dose of investigational medicinal product at Day 1 of each visit (time points -45 min and -15 min). Trough at Day 2 was computed as the average of the two values measured at 23 and 24 hours after administration of the morning dose of investigational medicinal product on Day 1. At each time point, three technically adequate lung function measurements were performed by spirometry according to the acceptability and repeatability criteria of the ATS/ERS; the highest values for the FEV1 and FVC were selected.
outcome.population: Patients in the ITT population with available data at the timepoints of interest. ITT population defined as patients who took at least one dose of investigational medicinal product and had at least a baseline and one post-dose value of FEV1 from at least one treatment period

measure.title: Change From Baseline to Trough Forced Vital Capacity (FVC)
measure.description: Baseline was the average of the two values measured just prior to the administration of the dose of investigational medicinal product at Day 1 of each visit (time points -45 min and -15 min). Trough at Day 2 was computed as the average of the two values measured at 23 and 24 hours after administration of the morning dose of investigational medicinal product on Day 1. At each time point, three technically adequate lung function measurements were performed by spirometry according to the acceptability and repeatability criteria of the ATS/ERS; the highest values for the FEV1 and FVC were selected.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Normalized Forced Vital Capacity (FVC) Area Under the Curve (AUC)
outcome.description: FVC was normalized to baseline. Baseline was the average of the two values measured just prior to the administration of the dose of investigational medicinal product at Day 1 of each visit (time points -45 min and -15 min). At each time point, three technically adequate lung function measurements were performed by spirometry according to the acceptability and repeatability criteria of the ATS/ERS; the highest values for the FEV1 and FVC were selected.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline and +15 min, +30 min, +1 h, +2 h, +3 h, +4 h, +6 h, +8 h, +12 h, +14 h, +23 h and +24 h
outcome.population: Patients in the ITT population with available data at the timepoints of interest. ITT population defined as patients who took at least one dose of investigational medicinal product and had at least a baseline and one post-dose value of FEV1 from at least one treatment period

reported_events.time_frame: Up to 14 (±2) days after last intake of investigational medicinal product
reported_events.desc: Safety population defined as all randomized patients who took at least 1 dose of investigational medicinal product The total number of patients in the safety population was 62; due to study drop-out and the crossover study design, not all patients received all treatments

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Publication and/or presentation whether complete or partial, of any part of the data or results of this trial will be subject to revision and written agreement between the investigator and sponsor
